Flub.Name: Erosion
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Duration
Flub.Description: Determines the duration of erosion simulation. This parameter can be set to higher value than 1.0, but note that even default 0.04 (4%) is enough for most cases, resulting in prominent erosion effect. Low duration values, such as 0.02 and lesser, can be useful for adding erosion details while keeping the main original landscape features unchanged.

Flub.Name: Rock Softness
Flub.Description: Controls the softness of rock material. The softer rock is, the faster is erosion process.

Flub.Name: Strength
Flub.Description: Sets the strength of fluvial erosion. This parameter controls the sediment transport capacity, that is how much of dissolved minerals water can carry. This parameter can be set to value that is higher than 1.0, this can speed up the erosion process, but also can result in lesser erosion quality, especially if erosion softness value is high too.

Flub.Name: Downcutting
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Downcutting
Flub.Description: This parameter controls the amount of downcutting, or vertical erosion. This is additional erosion mechanics, allowing water to transport sediments beyond the fluvial capacity by dragging and moving undissolved materials. This results in deeper gullies, and can be useful for getting mountain ranges.

Flub.Name: Inhibition
Flub.Description: This parameter controls special mechanics, adding additional restraints for downcutting. It determines how undissolved sediments are slowed down by already dropped sediments, causing downcutting to stop and drop its load. This allows to combine both variants of erosion, with and without downcutting, resulting at deep channels at some areas and alluvial fans in other areas.

Flub.Name: Base Level
Flub.Description: Controls the base level for the vertical erosion process, this is the lowest elevation that downcutting process can erode until it stops and begins to drop sediment. This elevation is different across the whole terrain, and depends on the terrain slopes, relative altitudes, stream velocity and other factors. This parameter can be useful for filling the largest valleys with deposit material, forming valley floors.

Flub.Name: Scale
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Real Scale
Flub.Description: Automatically determine the scale from the Terrain Definition.

Flub.Name: Feature Scale
Flub.Description: Determines the lateral size of the largest erosion features in meters: width of largest valleys and ridges between them.

Flub.Name: Terrain Scale
Flub.Description:
Available when Real Scale is turned Off
The simulated scale of the entire width of the terrain.

Flub.Name: Verticality
Flub.Description:
Available when Real Scale is turned Off
The simulated height of the entire terrain.

Flub.Name: Flow
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Random Sedimentation
Flub.Description: This parameter controls randomization of sedimentation process. In the cases of usual, uniform erosion it rarely has effect because multiple flows, dropping sediments randomly, results in uniform deposition field, thus cancelling random sedimentation effect. This parameter is for some non-standard scenarios, for example, masked precipitation, where precipitation occurs at some areas only.

Flub.Name: Volume
Flub.Description: This is another special parameter, which alters erosion physics, treating water flows as volumetric objects, affecting each other, causing higher water levels during simulation, which results in wider channels, filled with more deposits. This is another way to get valley floor, and it works without downcutting.

Flub.Name: Rivers
Flub.Description: Artificially carve rivers in the strongest flow lines.

Flub.Name: Depth
Flub.Description:
Available when Rivers is turned On
The depth of the rivers that are carved.

Flub.Name: Selective Processing
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Area Effect
Flub.Description: This is the effect applied when an Area input is specified, or if Bias is defined in the settings.

Flub.Name: Erosion Strength
Flub.Description: The input mask controls the erosion strength.

Flub.Name: Rock Softness
Flub.Description: The input mask controls the rock softness.

Flub.Name: Precipitation Amount
Flub.Description: In this mode mask controls rained areas, allowing to rainfall to occur in the selected area only. The brighter mask is, the more water is rained. This masking mode allows to avoid boring look of uniformly eroded terrain.

Flub.Name: None
Flub.Description: Do not apply selective processing.

Flub.Name: Bias Type
Flub.Description: The type of automatic bias to apply when an Area input is not specified.

Flub.Name: Bias
Flub.Description: The strength of the bias. For Slope, it is the steepness, for Altitude it the position from bottom.

Flub.Name: Reverse
Flub.Description: Reverse the bias direction.

Flub.Name: Other Settings
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.

Flub.Name: Aggressive Mode
Flub.Description: Process erosion faster at the risk of creating soft erosion artifacts in some minor areas.
